member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Implementation.KeyboardState
member.summary: Contains a snapshot of a keyboard state at certain moment and provides methods of querying whether specific keys are pressed or locked.
member.remarks: This class is basically a managed wrapper of GetKeyboardState API function http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms646299

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Implementation.KeyboardState.GetCurrent
member.summary: Makes a snapshot of a keyboard state to the moment of call and returns an instance of class.
member.returns: An instance of class representing a snapshot of keyboard state at certain moment.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Implementation.KeyboardState.IsDown(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Indicates whether specified key was down at the moment when snapshot was created or not.
member.param: Key (corresponds to the virtual code of the key)
member.returns: true if key was down, false - if key was up.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Implementation.KeyboardState.IsToggled(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Indicate weather specified key was toggled at the moment when snapshot was created or not.
member.param: Key (corresponds to the virtual code of the key)
member.returns: true if toggle key like (CapsLock, NumLocke, etc.) was on. false if it was off. Ordinal (non toggle) keys return always false.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Implementation.KeyboardState.AreAllDown(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Windows.Forms.Keys})
member.summary: Indicates weather every of specified keys were down at the moment when snapshot was created. The method returns false if even one of them was up.
member.param: Keys to verify whether they were down or not.
member.returns: true - all were down. false - at least one was up.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Hook
member.summary: This is the class to start with.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Hook.AppEvents
member.summary: Here you find all application wide events. Both mouse and keyboard.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.Hook.GlobalEvents
member.summary: Here you find all application wide events. Both mouse and keyboard.
member.returns: Returned instance is used for event subscriptions. You can refetch it (you will get the same instance anyway).

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IKeyboardMouseEvents
member.summary: Provides keyboard and mouse events.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseMove
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is moved.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseMoveExt
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is moved.
member.remarks: This event provides extended arguments of type enabling you to suppress further processing of mouse movement in other applications.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseClick
member.summary: Occurs when a click was performed by the mouse.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDown
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse a mouse button is pressed.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDownExt
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse a mouse button is pressed.
member.remarks: This event provides extended arguments of type enabling you to suppress further processing of mouse click in other applications.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseUp
member.summary: Occurs when a mouse button is released.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseUpExt
member.summary: Occurs when a mouse button is released.
member.remarks: This event provides extended arguments of type enabling you to suppress further processing of mouse click in other applications.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseWheel
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse wheel moves.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseWheelExt
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse wheel moves.
member.remarks: This event provides extended arguments of type enabling you to suppress further processing of mouse wheel moves in other applications.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDoubleClick
member.summary: Occurs when a mouse button is double-clicked.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDragStarted
member.summary: Occurs when a drag event has started (left button held down whilst moving more than the system drag threshold).

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDragStartedExt
member.summary: Occurs when a drag event has started (left button held down whilst moving more than the system drag threshold).
member.remarks: This event provides extended arguments of type enabling you to suppress further processing of mouse movement in other applications.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDragFinished
member.summary: Occurs when a drag event has completed.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IMouseEvents.MouseDragFinishedExt
member.summary: Occurs when a drag event has completed.
member.remarks: This event provides extended arguments of type enabling you to suppress further processing of mouse movement in other applications.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IKeyboardEvents
member.summary: Provides keyboard events

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IKeyboardEvents.KeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when a key is pressed.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IKeyboardEvents.KeyPress
member.summary: Occurs when a key is pressed.
member.remarks:
Key events occur in the following order:
KeyDown
KeyPress
KeyUp
The KeyPress event is not raised by non-character keys; however, the non-character keys do raise the KeyDown and KeyUp events. Use the KeyChar property to sample keystrokes at run time and to consume or modify a subset of common keystrokes. To handle keyboard events only in your application and not enable other applications to receive keyboard events, set the property in your form's KeyPress event-handling method to true.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.IKeyboardEvents.KeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when a key is released.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyPressEventArgsExt
member.summary: Provides extended data for the event.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Character corresponding to the key pressed. 0 char if represents a system or functional non char key.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyPressEventArgsExt.IsNonChar
member.summary: True if represents a system or functional non char key.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyPressEventArgsExt.Timestamp

member.remarks: The AppMouseStruct does not have a timestamp, thus one is generated at the time of this call.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookIds.WH_MOUSE
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors mouse messages. For more information, see the MouseProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookIds.WH_KEYBOARD
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors keystroke messages. For more information, see the KeyboardProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookIds.WH_MOUSE_LL
member.summary: Windows NT/2000/XP/Vista/7: Installs a hook procedure that monitors low-level mouse input events.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookIds.WH_KEYBOARD_LL
member.summary: Windows NT/2000/XP/Vista/7: Installs a hook procedure that monitors low-level keyboard input events.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookNativeMethods.CallNextHookEx(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The CallNextHookEx function passes the hook information to the next hook procedure in the current hook chain. A hook procedure can call this function either before or after processing the hook information.
member.param: This parameter is ignored.
[in] Specifies the hook code passed to the current hook procedure.
[in] Specifies the wParam value passed to the current hook procedure.
[in] Specifies the lParam value passed to the current hook procedure.
member.returns: This value is returned by the next hook procedure in the chain.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/setwindowshookex.asp

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookNativeMethods.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookProcedure,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SetWindowsHookEx function installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.param: [in] Specifies the type of hook procedure to be installed. This parameter can be one of the following values.

[in] Pointer to the hook procedure. If the dwThreadId parameter is zero or specifies the identifier of a thread created by a different process, the lpfn parameter must point to a hook procedure in a dynamic-link library (DLL). Otherwise, lpfn can point to a hook procedure in the code associated with the current process.

[in] Handle to the DLL containing the hook procedure pointed to by the lpfn parameter. The hMod parameter must be set to NULL if the dwThreadId parameter specifies a thread created by the current process and if the hook procedure is within the code associated with the current process.

[in] Specifies the identifier of the thread with which the hook procedure is to be associated. If this parameter is zero, the hook procedure is associated with all existing threads running in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/setwindowshookex.asp

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookNativeMethods.UnhookWindowsHookEx(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The UnhookWindowsHookEx function removes a hook procedure installed in a hook chain by the SetWindowsHookEx function.
member.param: [in] Handle to the hook to be removed. This parameter is a hook handle obtained by a previous call to SetWindowsHookEx.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/setwindowshookex.asp

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HotkeysNativeMethods.RegisterHotKey(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Defines a system-wide hot key.
member.param: A handle to the window that will receive WM_HOTKEY messages generated by the hot key. If this parameter is NULL, WM_HOTKEY messages are posted to the message queue of the calling thread and must be processed in the message loop.

The identifier of the hot key. If the hWnd parameter is NULL, then the hot key is associated with the current thread rather than with a particular window. If a hot key already exists with the same hWnd and id parameters, see Remarks for the action taken.

The keys that must be pressed in combination with the key specified by the uVirtKey parameter in order to generate the WM_HOTKEY message. The fsModifiers parameter can be a combination of the following values.
The virtual-key code of the hot key. See Virtual Key Codes.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HotkeysNativeMethods.UnregisterHotKey(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Frees a hot key previously registered by the calling thread.
member.param: A handle to the window associated with the hot key to be freed. This parameter should be NULL if the hot key is not associated with a window.
The identifier of the hot key to be freed.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.MouseNativeMethods.GetDoubleClickTime
member.summary: The GetDoubleClickTime function retrieves the current double-click time for the mouse. A double-click is a series of two clicks of the mouse button, the second occurring within a specified time after the first. The double-click time is the maximum number of milliseconds that may occur between the first and second click of a double-click.
member.returns: The return value specifies the current double-click time, in milliseconds.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms646258(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardHookStruct.Time
member.summary: Specifies the Time stamp for this message.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardHookStruct.ExtraInfo
member.summary: Specifies extra information associated with the message.

member.summary: The Point structure defines the X- and Y- coordinates of a point.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Point.X
member.summary: Specifies the X-coordinate of the point.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Point.Y

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.HookProcedure
member.summary: The CallWndProc hook procedure is an application-defined or library-defined callback function used with the SetWindowsHookEx function. The HOOKPROC type defines a pointer to this callback function. CallWndProc is a placeholder for the application-defined or library-defined function name.
member.param: [in] Specifies whether the hook procedure must process the message. If nCode is HC_ACTION, the hook procedure must process the message. If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must pass the message to the CallNextHookEx function without further processing and must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx.
[in] Specifies whether the message was sent by the current thread. If the message was sent by the current thread, it is nonzero; otherwise, it is zero.
[in] Pointer to a CWPSTRUCT structure that contains details about the message.
member.returns: If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx. If nCode is greater than or equal to zero, it is highly recommended that you call CallNextHookEx and return the value it returns; otherwise, other applications that have installed WH_CALLWNDPROC hooks will not receive hook notifications and may behave incorrectly as a result. If the hook procedure does not call CallNextHookEx, the return value should be zero.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/callwndproc.asp

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.TryGetCharFromKeyboardState(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char[]@)
member.summary: Translates a virtual key to its character equivalent using the current keyboard layout without knowing the scancode in advance.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.TryGetCharFromKeyboardState(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char[]@)
member.summary: Translates a virtual key to its character equivalent using the current keyboard layout

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.TryGetCharFromKeyboardState(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Char[]@)
member.summary: Translates a virtual key to its character equivalent using a specified keyboard layout

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetActiveKeyboard
member.summary: Gets the input locale identifier for the active application's thread. Using this combined with the ToUnicodeEx and MapVirtualKeyEx enables Windows to properly translate keys based on the keyboard layout designated for the application.
member.returns: HKL

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.ToAscii(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: The ToAscii function translates the specified virtual-key code and keyboard state to the corresponding character or characters. The function translates the code using the input language and physical keyboard layout identified by the keyboard layout handle.
member.param: [in] Specifies the virtual-key code to be translated.
[in] Specifies the hardware scan code of the key to be translated. The high-order bit of this value is set if the key is up (not pressed).

[in] Pointer to a 256-byte array that contains the current keyboard state. Each element (byte) in the array contains the state of one key. If the high-order bit of a byte is set, the key is down (pressed). The low bit, if set, indicates that the key is toggled on. In this function, only the toggle bit of the CAPS LOCK key is relevant. The toggle state of the NUM LOCK and SCROLL LOCK keys is ignored.
[out] Pointer to the buffer that receives the translated character or characters.
[in] Specifies whether a menu is active. This parameter must be 1 if a menu is active, or 0 otherwise.
member.returns: If the specified key is a dead key, the return value is negative. Otherwise, it is one of the following values. Value Meaning 0 The specified virtual key has no translation for the current state of the keyboard. 1 One character was copied to the buffer. 2 Two characters were copied to the buffer. This usually happens when a dead-key character (accent or diacritic) stored in the keyboard layout cannot be composed with the specified virtual key to form a single character.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/userinput/keyboardinput/keyboardinputreference/keyboardinputfunctions/toascii.asp

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.ToUnicodeEx(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Translates the specified virtual-key code and keyboard state to the corresponding Unicode character or characters.
member.param: [in] The virtual-key code to be translated.
[in] The hardware scan code of the key to be translated. The high-order bit of this value is set if the key is up.

[in, optional] A pointer to a 256-byte array that contains the current keyboard state. Each element (byte) in the array contains the state of one key. If the high-order bit of a byte is set, the key is down.

[out] The buffer that receives the translated Unicode character or characters. However, this buffer may be returned without being null-terminated even though the variable name suggests that it is null-terminated.
[in] The size, in characters, of the buffer pointed to by the pwszBuff parameter.
[in] The behavior of the function. If bit 0 is set, a menu is active. Bits 1 through 31 are reserved.
The input locale identifier used to translate the specified code.
member.returns:
-1 <= return <= n
-1 = The specified virtual key is a dead-key character (accent or diacritic). This value is returned regardless of the keyboard layout, even if several characters have been typed and are stored in the keyboard state. If possible, even with Unicode keyboard layouts, the function has written a spacing version of the dead-key character to the buffer specified by pwszBuff. For example, the function writes the character SPACING ACUTE (0x00B4), rather than the character NON_SPACING ACUTE (0x0301).
0 = The specified virtual key has no translation for the current state of the keyboard. Nothing was written to the buffer specified by pwszBuff.
1 = One character was written to the buffer specified by pwszBuff.
n = Two or more characters were written to the buffer specified by pwszBuff. The most common cause for this is that a dead-key character (accent or diacritic) stored in the keyboard layout could not be combined with the specified virtual key to form a single character. However, the buffer may contain more characters than the return value specifies. When this happens, any extra characters are invalid and should be ignored.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetKeyboardState(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The GetKeyboardState function copies the status of the 256 virtual keys to the specified buffer.
member.param: [in] Pointer to a 256-byte array that contains keyboard key states.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/userinput/keyboardinput/keyboardinputreference/keyboardinputfunctions/toascii.asp

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: The GetKeyState function retrieves the status of the specified virtual key. The status specifies whether the key is up, down, or toggled (on, offâ€”alternating each time the key is pressed).
member.param: [in] Specifies a virtual key. If the desired virtual key is a letter or digit (A through Z, a through z, or 0 through 9), nVirtKey must be set to the ASCII value of that character. For other keys, it must be a virtual-key code.
member.returns: The return value specifies the status of the specified virtual key, as follows: If the high-order bit is 1, the key is down; otherwise, it is up. If the low-order bit is 1, the key is toggled. A key, such as the CAPS LOCK key, is toggled if it is turned on. The key is off and untoggled if the low-order bit is 0. A toggle key's indicator light (if any) on the keyboard will be on when the key is toggled, and off when the key is untoggled.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms646301.aspx

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapVirtualKeyEx(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Translates (maps) a virtual-key code into a scan code or character value, or translates a scan code into a virtual-key code.
member.param: [in] The virtual key code or scan code for a key. How this value is interpreted depends on the value of the uMapType parameter.
[in] The translation to be performed. The value of this parameter depends on the value of the uCode parameter.
[in] The input locale identifier used to translate the specified code.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetKeyboardLayout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the active input locale identifier (formerly called the keyboard layout) for the specified thread. If the idThread parameter is zero, the input locale identifier for the active thread is returned.
member.param: [in] The identifier of the thread to query, or 0 for the current thread.
member.returns: The return value is the input locale identifier for the thread. The low word contains a Language Identifier for the input language and the high word contains a device handle to the physical layout of the keyboard.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapType
member.summary: MapVirtualKeys uMapType

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapType.MAPVK_VK_TO_VSC
member.summary: uCode is a virtual-key code and is translated into an unshifted character value in the low-order word of the return value. Dead keys (diacritics) are indicated by setting the top bit of the return value. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapType.MAPVK_VSC_TO_VK
member.summary: uCode is a virtual-key code and is translated into a scan code. If it is a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys, the left-hand scan code is returned. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapType.MAPVK_VK_TO_CHAR
member.summary: uCode is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapType.MAPVK_VSC_TO_VK_EX
member.summary: uCode is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that distinguishes between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor moves.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_LBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_LBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_RBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEWHEEL message is posted when the user presses the mouse wheel.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_XBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X mouse button.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_XBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X mouse button.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X mouse button.
member.remarks: Only windows that have the CS_DBLCLKS style can receive WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK messages.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MOUSEHWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEHWHEEL message Sent to the active window when the mouse's horizontal scroll wheel is tilted or rotated.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a non-system key is pressed. A non-system key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a non-system key is released. A non-system key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.ThreadNativeMethods.GetCurrentThreadId
member.summary: Retrieves the unmanaged thread identifier of the calling thread.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.ThreadNativeMethods.GetForegroundWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.ThreadNativeMethods.GetWindowThreadProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the thread that created the specified window and, optionally, the identifier of the process that created the window.
member.param: A handle to the window.
A pointer to a variable that receives the process identifier. If this parameter is not NULL, GetWindowThreadProcessId copies the identifier of the process to the variable; otherwise, it does not.
member.returns: The return value is the identifier of the thread that created the window.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyEventArgsExt
member.summary: Provides extended argument data for the or event.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyEventArgsExt.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyEventArgsExt.Timestamp
member.summary: The system tick count of when the event occurred.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyEventArgsExt.IsKeyDown
member.summary: True if event signals key down..

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyEventArgsExt.IsKeyUp
member.summary: True if event signals key up.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs
member.summary: Provides extended data for the MouseClickExt and MouseMoveExt events.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.MouseButtons,System.Int32,Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.WinApi.Point,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: One of the MouseButtons values indicating which mouse button was pressed.
The number of times a mouse button was pressed.
The x and y coordinate of a mouse click, in pixels.
A signed count of the number of detents the wheel has rotated.
The system tick count when the event occurred.
True if event signals mouse button down.
True if event signals mouse button up.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.Handled
member.summary: Set this property to true inside your event handler to prevent further processing of the event in other applications.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.WheelScrolled
member.summary: True if event contains information about wheel scroll.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.Clicked
member.summary: True if event signals a click. False if it was only a move or wheel scroll.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.IsMouseButtonDown
member.summary: True if event signals mouse button down.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.IsMouseButtonUp
member.summary: True if event signals mouse button up.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.MouseEventExtArgs.Timestamp
member.summary: The system tick count of when the event occurred.

member.summary: Creates from relevant mouse data.
member.param: First Windows Message parameter.
A MouseStruct containing information from which to construct MouseEventExtArgs.
member.returns: A new MouseEventExtArgs object.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeyArgs
member.summary: The event arguments passed when a HotKeySet's OnHotKeysDownHold event is triggered.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeyArgs.#ctor(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the HotKeyArgs. Time when the event was triggered

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeyArgs.Time
member.summary: Time when the event was triggered

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet
member.summary: An immutable set of Hot Keys that provides an event for when the set is activated.

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.HotKeyHandler
member.summary: A delegate representing the signature for the OnHotKeysDownHold event

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Windows.Forms.Keys})
member.summary: Creates an instance of the HotKeySet class. Once created, the keys cannot be changed.
member.param: Set of Hot Keys

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.Name
member.summary: Enables the ability to name the set

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.Description
member.summary: Enables the ability to describe what the set is used for or supposed to do

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.HotKeys
member.summary: Gets the set of hotkeys that this class handles.

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.HotKeysActivated
member.summary: Returns whether the set of Keys is activated

member.name: P:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of the HotKey set.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.OnHotKeysDownHold
member.summary: Called as the user holds down the keys in the set. It is NOT triggered the first time the keys are set.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.OnHotKeysUp
member.summary: Called whenever the hot key set is no longer active. This is essentially a KeyPress event, indicating that a full key cycle has occurred, only for HotKeys because a single key removed from the set constitutes an incomplete set.

member.name: E:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.OnHotKeysDownOnce
member.summary: Called the first time the down keys are set. It does not get called throughout the duration the user holds it but only the first time it's activated.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.InvokeHotKeyHandler(Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.HotKeyHandler)
member.summary: General invocation handler

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.InitializeKeys
member.summary: Adds the keys into the dictionary tracking the keys and gets the real-time status of the Keys from the OS

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.UnregisterExclusiveOrKey(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Unregisters a previously set exclusive or based on the primary key.
member.param: Any key used in the Registration method used to create an exclusive or set
member.returns: True if successful. False doesn't indicate a failure to unregister, it indicates that the Key is not registered as an Exclusive Or key or it's not the Primary Key.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.RegisterExclusiveOrKey(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Windows.Forms.Keys})
member.returns: Primary key used for mapping or Keys.None on error

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.GetExclusiveOrPrimaryKey(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Gets the primary key
member.returns: The primary key if it exists, otherwise Keys.None

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet.GetPrimaryKey(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Resolves obtaining the key used for state checking.
member.returns: The primary key if it exists, otherwise the key entered

member.name: T:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySetCollection
member.summary: A collection of HotKeySets

member.summary: Adds a HotKeySet to the collection.

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySetCollection.Remove(Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySet)

member.name: M:Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.HotKeys.HotKeySetCollection.OnKey(Gma.System.MouseKeyHook.KeyEventArgsExt)
member.summary: Uses a multi-case delegate to invoke individual HotKeySets if the Key is in use by any HotKeySets.
